p: Hemp ( Cannabis sativa L.) is a new-old crop, one of the most controversial and promising crops due to its multiple utilizations, and contains a wide array of biologically active substances synthesized and accumulated in different plant parts [ 1]. Industrial hemp has been grown for grain and fiber for many decades in Europe, Asia, and North America. In addition, there is wild hemp ( C. sativa spp. spontanea Vavilov, also known as spontaneous), which is native to both Central and Eastern Europe as well as parts of Asia, and is found as a weed in agricultural fields.
